definition: to lose one's life/to die/recklessly/desperately
(negative prefix for verbs)/have not/not
drowned/to end/to die/to inundate
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc

sentences.english: These windows are 9 inches thick. If they go, it's sayonara in two microseconds.
sentences.chinese: 窗的厚度是9寸，要是破裂，所有的人转眼就没命。

sentences.english: Most of crucian carp, lives in in running water wild.
sentences.chinese: 大部分是鲫鱼，没命地在湍急的流水中撒野。

sentences.english: If they had given up searching, I would have died.
sentences.chinese: 如果当时他们放弃了搜寻，那么我就没命了。

sentences.english: He was hit by several bullets, and almost died.
sentences.chinese: 他身上被打中了几枪，差一点就没命了。

sentences.english: With that man's help, Tianlin ran desperately for the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 在那人的帮助下，天林没命地朝医院跑去。

sentences.english: Sucre steps on an explosive mine and cannot lift his foot without it being blown off.
sentences.chinese: 苏克雷踩到了一个地雷上，如果抬脚他就没命了。

sentences.english: The fever,if not brought down,might and would kill the young fellow.
sentences.chinese: 要是不及时退烧，年轻人就没命了。

definition: (dialect) to rush off/to scamper off double-quick/to take to one's heels/to make oneself scarce
rolling and crawling/trying frantically to escape (idiom)
to take to one's heels/to scram
to break into a run
doom/death/desperately
to go mad/to go crazy/to lose one's mind
to lose one's life/to get killed
to die (idiom)/to breathe one's last/to give up the ghost
see 拼命[pin1 ming4]
to vanish/to be nowhere to be found/unfounded (story)
to run away/to take to one's heels
to piss in one's pants in terror (idiom); scared witless
(coll.) to be done for
to run like the wind/to rush/to gallop
to escape/to flee/to run for one's life
to flee/to run away
